channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken /noisy soak away drain, 9th July
item.description:
This is on the entrance ramp of sainsburys dartford carpark , it was repaired with a metal sheet a couple of years ago but has now broken , it’s very noisy and directly behind my garden wall. The carpark was recently taken over by euro carparks …. Nobody including sainsburys or the priory centre seem to have contact details to report this and the phone number on the signs is solely for marketing and isn’t an answer phone , I’ve tried emailing but had no reply as yet
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household trash is being improperly dumped, 9th July
item.description:
Household trash is being improperly dumped into public bins, causing them to overflow and spill onto pedestrian pathways. This leads to blocked walkways, unpleasant smells, visual pollution, and health risks. The issue is often due to inadequate household
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defect at base of stem, 9th July
item.description:
Hornbeam, approx. 15m, standing by a desire line footpath. significant defect at base. May require inspection unless recently undertaken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurst Road, Albany Park, London

item.title: Infested bush obstructing pavement, 9th July
item.description:
Outside where 57/59 Mundania Road meet there is a fly infested bush overhanging half the, already narrow, pavement. You have to brush against the bush to get past and as you do a swarm of flies come out at you. Unfortunately this is right by a pavement tree which has thorns growing out the bottom. Danger to children, blind people, disabled people
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mundania Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Parking space blocks traffic sensor, no space for cars to exit road, 9th July
item.description:
The parking space at the top of the road effectively blocks cars from leaving this junction because the Passive infra red sensor on the traffic light doesn't appear to reliability pick up cars leaving the junction. The additional parking spaces also block cars from leaving the road if there is any traffic coming the other way. Removing the top parking space would likely easily fix this problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Novar Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter/Refuse, 9th July
item.description:
Excessive ammounts of litter/refuse constantly accumulate on this section of Farjeon Road causing a health risk and a disgraceful eyesore. Perhaps some signage informing people of the penalties for their anti social behaviour might have some effect - or more regular street/pavement cleaning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farjeon Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Use of glyphosate weed killer, 9th July
item.description:
As insect populations are declining on an unprecedented scale- I would like to stop the use of glyphosate weed killer in my local environment - I understand many boroughs have stopped using glyphosate- can I please opt to clear the weeds manually in my street so that glyphosate is no longer used. I understand this is an option - how do I get this achieved?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King William IV Gardens, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
